body: @objmagic - can you fix the travis?

@kramasamy I just added an annotations processor which will emit warnings at compile time if a non-heron class extends a class marked as Private, LimitedPrivate or Unsable. 

```
$ javac -cp "bazel-bin/heron/spi/src/java/libheron-spi.jar:bazel-bin/heron/api/src/java/libclassification.jar:bazel-bin/heron/proto/libproto_topology_java.jar" billg/*.java com/twitter/heron/*.java
billg/BillPacking.java:17: warning: billg.BillPacking extends from a class annotated with com.twitter.heron.classification.InterfaceStability.Unstable
public class BillPacking extends com.twitter.heron.NullPacking {
       ^
billg/BillPacking.java:17: warning: billg.BillPacking extends from a class annotated with com.twitter.heron.classification.InterfaceAudience.LimitedPrivate
public class BillPacking extends com.twitter.heron.NullPacking {
       ^
2 warnings
```
@billonahill - this is great!.
ship it üëç

@objmagic I'll take a look at it

@waitingkuo - I think the actual fix could be for the tracker to wait until those directories/zk nodes are created by polling every second. Once we have this - independent of whether the tracker starts first or later, it will correctly.
@zuyu - do you have a quick step hash function that we can for uniform distribution - despite the presence of skew.
@ashvina and @billonahill - who wants to pick this up.
@kramasamy We use [FarmHash](https://github.com/google/farmhash) for strings.
@zuyu - can we use it for other data types?
Now heron support python topologies. Please try it out and let us know. It is in the master now - soon we will have a release.

Yes, but limited.

https://github.com/google/farmhash/blob/master/src/farmhash.h#L124
Btw, the example shows a string-based hash result.

@kramasamy - Just checked the code. 

```
topologies = filter(     
    lambda f: os.path.isfile(os.path.join(topologies_path, f)), os.listdir(topologies_path))
```

It intends to collect the topologies every few seconds. How about modifying as

```
topologies = []
if os.path.isdir(topologies_path):
    topologies = filter(     
        lambda f: os.path.isfile(os.path.join(topologies_path, f)), os.listdir(topologies_path))
```

If the path isn't existed, just returns a empty array.

Could you give me a hint that how I build this tool via Bazel without building all the codes.

@waitingkuo - sure please try this out. If you want to just install the tools, do the following 

```
bazel run --config=<your-platform> -- scripts/packages:heron-tools-install.sh --user 
```

and then run heron-tracker and heron-ui before launching topologies and see if that works.
docker-compose works normally after adding this

@objmagic @billonahill just signed

I too can free up some cycles for this improvement. May be this can be done incrementally, one interface at a time.

BTW, I spoke to a couple of folks here about Guice. [Dagger](http://square.github.io/dagger/) and [Tang](https://reef.apache.org/tang.html) seem to have evolved from Guice. Both systems provide static compile time checks which seem to be a major limitation of Guice. So I think we could use the newer solutions. I used tang in the YARN scheduler. Most of the configuration errors will be flagged by the IDE itself. It reduced number of required iterations. If you think it helps, I can create a small patch as an example. Although the Tang community is very active, there is limited support available outside.

Misc references on Dagger
1. https://dig.floatingsun.net/dagger-vs-guice-8c9fbae4712e#.e1223p2x7
1. https://blog.gouline.net/dagger-2-even-sharper-less-square-b52101863542#.pkksdqat1
@ashvina and @billonahill - if you could collaborate and come with a plan, it will be great!

@billonahill Made the changes you suggested and fixed all the tests. Let me know if it looks good to you.
@kramasamy The merge conflicts are resolved now. Thanks !
@kramasamy this issue can be closed now?
yes. Fixed in #1245
@nlu90 - is this done?
@ajorgensen @billonahill - is this good to go? I am trying to get 0.14.3 release quickly.
This error was discussed before. It is because metrics for these components are not available.

Committing a change to go with option 2 actually (`IScalableScheduler extends IScheduler`), since I don't think we'd ever have a non-scheduler class implement add/remove functionality, but I'm already second guessing that choice over option 1 (`IScalable`). Opinions welcome.

Also moved the interface to `c.t.h.spi.scheduler` and removed `existingContainers`.
Related: https://github.com/twitter/heron/blob/master/heron/tmaster/src/cpp/manager/tmetrics-collector.cpp#L112

@kramasamy 
1. For release purpose, you can use the pom.xml file and maven to do a binary release. And also since the code will finally be moved into a separate repo, we should keep it decoupled with other part of the heron repo. Adding a build file also requires changes in the WORKSPACE file to include the extra binary dependencies, changes in other build scripts to integrate with the release scripts. Those changes need to be reverted once the code is moved. I think it's not a good practice.
2. This PR also includes the unit tests
3. I'm fine with either. I can change it to src/java
@maosongfu and @ashvina all comments addresses, let me know if this looks ok to you.
